Qualitative Result. Results from Table 6 indicate a negative and significant impact of temperature shocks on labor productivity growth, remarkably consistent with TFP regression results. End of sample year used. A value of 0 indicates only a qualitative judgement is available.

Average warming of 3.912 °C
Cumulative effect over almost 100 years, an upper bound estimate
Temperature increase of 4.9°C from 2005-2205, or 5.7°C above pre-industrial levels. Dietz and Stern (2015) scenario adjusted with author's estimates

Upper bound estimate. This is the maximum estimated negative effect of climate change on TFP growth.
